Maribor uspešno rešen tudi 500-kilogramske bombe
03 Nov 2019, 16:39 by STA

Maribor se po uspešnem uničenju dveh letalskih bomb iz druge svetovne vojne, ki so ju konec prejšnjega tedna našli na dveh gradbiščih, lahko vrne v običajno življenje. Po uspešni četrtkovi akciji so strokovnjaki državne enote za varstvo pred neeksplodiranimi ubojnimi sredstvi danes uspešno deaktivirali še drugo bombo, najdeno ob železniški progi.



Tudi ta bomba bo zdaj šla na začasno skladiščenje, nato pa jo bodo s sežigom uničili v roku treh mesecev.  Foto: STA

MARIBOR > Potem ko so že v četrtek onesposobili 250-kilogramsko bombo na gradbišču za največjim mariborskim nakupovalnim središčem, jih je tokrat čakala 500-kilogramska bomba, najdena na gradbišču ob železniški progi v bližini glavne avtobusne postaje.
Za pirotehnike nekoliko bolj pestro kot v četrtek
Kot je povedal pirotehnik Sašo Turnšek, ki je bombo deaktiviral skupaj z Aljažem Lebanom, je bilo danes nekoliko bolj pestro, a se je na koncu z nekaj več truda in napora vendarle izteklo tako, kot so si zadali. Samega postopka nista podrobno razkrila, sta pa povedala, da sta vžigalnik odvila s posebnim orodjem, ki jima ga je zrisal poveljnik enote.
"Vse skupaj je bilo malo drugače kot v četrtek, saj je bila bomba nekoliko poškodovana, zato je bilo potrebnega nekaj več dela," je povedal Leban, oba pirotehnika pa sta na koncu priznala, da sta si tudi sama po koncu akcije oddahnila. Ob tem je Leban skromno dodal, da so velik del posla v teh dveh dneh opravili drugi, ki so sodelovali v akciji in so jim omogočili nemoteno delo.
Tudi poveljnik državne enote za varstvo pred neeksplodiranimi ubojnimi sredstvi Darko Zonjič je poudaril izredno sodelovanje z vsemi pristojnimi mariborskimi službami, prav tako pa pohvalil vse Mariborčane, ki so resnično upoštevali navodila pristojnih služb.
"Evakuacija je bila odlično izpeljana in potem je tudi nam lažje delati. Če tega ne bi bilo, bi lahko še zdaj čakali na začetek akcije," je dejal in dodal, da na srečo niso potrebovali načrta B, ki bi bil dosti težji.
Uničili jo bodo v roku treh mesecev
Tudi ta bomba bo zdaj po njegovih besedah šla na začasno skladiščenje, nato pa jo bodo s sežigom uničili v roku treh mesecev. Ker gre za res veliko količino eksploziva, bodo to izvedli postopoma, saj ne želijo povzročati škode v naravi. Zadnje, kar uporabijo, je detonacija, pravi Zonjič, ki je še dodal, da bi v primeru detonacije danes v Mariboru lahko govorili tudi o veliki materialni škodi.
Čeprav si vsi skupaj želijo, da takih primerov v Mariboru več ne bi bilo, je to po njegovih besedah zelo težko napovedati, saj je v mestu zagotovo še kar nekaj neeksplodiranih bomb. "Morda bo prednost v tem, če bo občina res spremenila pravila tako, da bo potrebna pred gradnjo detekcija terena, saj bi v tem primeru imeli stvari bolj pod nadzorom," je dodal Zonjič.
Po besedah namestnika poveljnika mariborske civilne zaščite Mateja Zupaniča je v teh dneh pri odstranjevanju obeh bomb sodelovalo okoli 270 ljudi, od gasilcev, policistov, železničarjev in predstavnikov nekaterih občinskih služb, ki so skupaj dokazali, da sistem deluje. Še največ težav je bilo na samem začetku, a nato so stvari stekle.
Velik zalogaj je bila tudi evakuacija stanovalcev, predvsem danes, ko je moralo svoje domove zapustiti okoli tisoč ljudi. Tudi to je po njegovem uspelo, saj je zelo dobro potekalo obveščanje, za kar se je zahvalil tudi medijem.
Vodja mariborske izpostave za zaščito in reševanje Ivanka Grilanc je prav tako ocenila, da so bili vsi odgovorni dobro usklajeni, čeprav je pri organizaciji sodelovalo zelo veliko različnih služb, poleg že omenjenih tudi Nigrad, Dars, Marprom, dispečerski zdravstveni center, plinarna in drugi. "Vse skupaj smo usklajevali v štabu, ki je bil zelo operativen," je dejala Grilančeva in dodala, da so se tudi ljudje v glavnem zavedali možne nevarnosti.

Maribor successfully rescues 500-pound bomb
03 Nov 2019, 15:39 by STA

After successfully destroying two WWII aircraft bombs found at two construction sites at the end of last week, Maribor can return to normal life. Following Thursday's successful campaign, experts from the state's Explosive Ordnance Protection Unit have today successfully deactivated another bomb found along the railway line.



Also, this bomb will now go into temporary storage and then be destroyed by incineration within three months. Photo: STA

MARIBOR> After dropping a 250-pound bomb at a construction site behind the largest shopping mall in Maribor on Thursday, a 500-pound bomb found at a construction site near the main bus station was waiting for them this time.
For pyrotechnics a little more varied than on Thursday
According to pyrotechnic technician Sasha Turnsek, who deactivated the bomb together with Aljaž Leban, today it was a little more varied, but in the end, with some more effort and effort, it still came out the way they set it. They did not go into detail about the process, but said that they unscrewed the lighter with a special tool, which was drawn by the unit commander.
"It was a little different than Thursday, as the bomb was slightly damaged, so it took a bit more work," Leban said, and both pyrotechnics eventually admitted that they had taken a breather after the end of the campaign. In addition, Leban modestly added that a large part of the work in these two days was done by others who participated in the campaign and enabled them to work smoothly.
The commander of the state unit for protection against unexploded ordnance Darko Zonjič also emphasized the extraordinary cooperation with all competent Maribor services, as well as praised all Maribor citizens who really followed the instructions of the competent services.
"The evacuation was well done and then it's easier for us to do. If it wasn't, we could still wait for the campaign to start," he said, adding that fortunately they did not need a plan B that was much more difficult.
It will be destroyed within three months
This bomb, too, will now go into temporary storage and then be destroyed by incineration within three months. Since it is a really large amount of explosives, they will carry it out gradually as they do not want to cause any damage in nature. The last thing they use is detonation, says Zonjic, who added that in the event of a detonation today in Maribor they could also talk about great material damage.
Although they all wish there were no more such cases in Maribor, this is very difficult to predict, as there are certainly quite a few unexploded bombs in the city. "It may be an advantage if the municipality really changes the rules so that they are needed before the construction of terrain detection, because in this case things would be more under control," Zonjic added.
According to Deputy Commander of the Maribor Civil Defense, Mate Zupanic, about 270 people were involved in the removal of both bombs these days, from firefighters, police officers, railroad workers and representatives of some municipal services, who have jointly proved that the system works. The most problems were at the outset, but then things got going.
The evacuation of the residents was also a big part, especially today, when around one thousand people had to leave their homes. He also succeeded in doing so, as communication was very good, and he thanked the media for that.
The head of the Maribor Branch for Protection and Rescue, Ivanka Grilanc, also estimated that all those responsible were well coordinated, although many different services were involved in the organization, in addition to the aforementioned Nigrad, Dars, Marprom, dispatching health center, gas and others. "We coordinated everything at the headquarters, which was very operational," Grilancheva said, adding that people were also mostly aware of the possible danger.
